questions.question_text: A globally distributed project team is running behind schedule due to the lack of team commitment and low morale. In order to bring the schedule back on track, what should the project manager do first?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Set up a meeting to perform a root cause analysis

Selected Answer: A
As first step, perform root cause analysis

A

According to the PMBOK Guide, the project manager should first assess the root causes of the lack of team commitment and low morale.

choices.B: Permanently colocate the team for better performance.
choices.C: Update the issue log and communicate it to the team.
choices.A: Set up a meeting to perform a root cause analysis.
choices.D: Seek the sponsor's approval to extend the project schedule.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Plan for training on agile tools and techniques used in the defined hybrid methodology for consistent application by all team members

D

According to the PMBOK Guide, the project manager should assess the team's knowledge gaps in agile methodologies and provide appropriate training and support to ensure everyone understands and can effectively implement the hybrid approach.

choices.B: Ask to execute the project with a predictive approach since there is a budget and schedule risk.
choices.A: Use the predictive approach for team members who are not knowledgeable in agile project delivery practices.
choices.C: Use crashing to reduce the critical path to ensure enough buffer to include the impact of the agile methodology update.
choices.D: Plan for training on agile tools and techniques used in the defined hybrid methodology for consistent application by all team members.

questions.question_text: A new relevant project stakeholder suggested a change to some of the project parameters midway through execution. What should the project manager do next?

choices.D: Accept the change and use contingency funds to implement this change with minimal schedule impacts.
choices.B: Transfer the change to the steering committee for them to evaluate and decide the appropriate next steps.
choices.A: Reject the change because it is contrary to what was agreed to during earlier phases of the project.
choices.C: Evaluate the proposed change with integrated change controls and discuss the change with the project sponsor.
